meanings.definition: Perfect or flawless in every way.
meanings.sent1: The cake she baked was absolutely perfecto.
meanings.sent2: She always makes perfecto drawings in art class.
meanings.sent3: His plan to wear socks on his hands was not perfecto.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in perfecto hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The diamond sparkled with a perfecto brilliance.

meanings.definition: A cigar of a particular size and shape.
meanings.sent1: He enjoyed smoking a perfecto after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The shop had a wide selection of perfecto cigars.
meanings.sent3: She mistook the perfecto for a regular cigar and was surprised by its size.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the perfecto filled the room with a rich scent.
meanings.sent5: The gentleman savored the perfecto slowly, enjoying every puff.
